OrganizationId.Description: The organization under which the resource exists.

ResourceId.Description: The resource for which members (users or groups) are associated.

EntityId.Description: The member (user or group) to associate to the resource.

GroupId.Description: The group to which the member (user or group) is associated.

MemberId.Description: The member (user or group) to associate to the group.

The organization under which the member (user or group) exists.

EntityId.Description: The member (user or group) to which this alias is added.

Alias.Description: The alias to add to the member set.

ClientToken.Description:
An idempotent token that ensures that an API request is executed only once.
This field is autopopulated if not provided.

OrganizationId.Description: The Amazon WorkMail organization for which the AvailabilityConfiguration will be created.

DomainName.Description: The domain to which the provider applies.

EwsProvider.Description: Exchange Web Services (EWS) availability provider definition. The request must contain exactly one provider definition, either EwsProvider or LambdaProvider .

LambdaProvider.Description: Lambda availability provider definition. The request must contain exactly one provider definition, either EwsProvider or LambdaProvider .

OrganizationId.Description: The organization under which the group is to be created.
The Amazon WorkMail organization under which the rule will be created.

ClientToken.Description:
The idempotency token for the client request.
This field is autopopulated if not provided.

Effect.Description: The effect of the rule when it matches. Allowed values are ALLOW or DENY .

DeviceTypes.Description: Device types that the rule will match.

NotDeviceTypes.Description: Device types that the rule will not match. All other device types will match.

DeviceModels.Description: Device models that the rule will match.

NotDeviceModels.Description: Device models that the rule will not match. All other device models will match.

DeviceOperatingSystems.Description: Device operating systems that the rule will match.

NotDeviceOperatingSystems.Description: Device operating systems that the rule will not match. All other device operating systems will match.

DeviceUserAgents.Description: Device user agents that the rule will match.

NotDeviceUserAgents.Description: Device user agents that the rule will not match. All other device user agents will match.

DirectoryId.Description: The AWS Directory Service directory ID.

ClientToken.Description:
The idempotency token associated with the request.
This field is autopopulated if not provided.

Domains.Description: The email domains to associate with the organization.

KmsKeyArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a customer managed master key from AWS KMS.

EnableInteroperability.Description: When true , allows organization interoperability between Amazon WorkMail and Microsoft Exchange. Can only be set to true if an AD Connector directory ID is included in the request.

OrganizationId.Description: The identifier associated with the organization for which the resource is created.

Name.Description: The name of the new resource.

Type.Description: The type of the new resource. The available types are equipment and room .

OrganizationId.Description: The identifier of the organization for which the user is created.

Name.Description: The name for the new user. WorkMail directory user names have a maximum length of 64. All others have a maximum length of 20.

DisplayName.Description: The display name for the new user.

Password.Description: The password for the new user.

OrganizationId.Description: The identifier for the organization.

Name.Description: The name of the access control rule.

OrganizationId.Description: The identifier for the organization under which the user exists.

EntityId.Description: The identifier for the member (user or group) from which to have the aliases removed.

Alias.Description: The aliases to be removed from the user's set of aliases. Duplicate entries in the list are collapsed into single entries (the list is transformed into a set).

DomainName.Description: The domain for which the AvailabilityConfiguration will be deleted.

IpRanges.Description: IPv4 CIDR ranges to include in the rule.

NotIpRanges.Description: IPv4 CIDR ranges to exclude from the rule.

Actions.Description: Access protocol actions to include in the rule. Valid values include ActiveSync, AutoDiscover, EWS, IMAP, SMTP, WindowsOutlook, and WebMail .

NotActions.Description: Access protocol actions to exclude from the rule. Valid values include ActiveSync, AutoDiscover, EWS, IMAP, SMTP, WindowsOutlook, and WebMail .

UserIds.Description: User IDs to include in the rule.

NotUserIds.Description: User IDs to exclude from the rule.

OrganizationId.Description: The identifier of the organization.
The ID of the organization for which the email monitoring configuration is set.

RoleArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM Role associated with the email monitoring configuration.

LogGroupArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CloudWatch Log group associated with the email monitoring configuration.

OrganizationId.Description: The ID of the organization that you are applying the DMARC policy to.

Enforced.Description: Enforces or suspends a policy after it's applied.

OrganizationId.Description: The identifier of the organization under which the user, group, or resource exists.

EntityId.Description: The identifier of the user, group, or resource for which to update mailbox permissions.

GranteeId.Description: The identifier of the user, group, or resource to which to grant the permissions.

PermissionValues.Description: The permissions granted to the grantee. SEND_AS allows the grantee to send email as the owner of the mailbox (the grantee is not mentioned on these emails). SEND_ON_BEHALF allows the grantee to send email on behalf of the owner of the mailbox (the grantee is not mentioned as the physical sender of these emails). FULL_ACCESS allows the grantee full access to the mailbox, irrespective of other folder-level permissions set on the mailbox.

OrganizationId.Description: Identifies the Amazon WorkMail organization for which you create the override.

UserId.Description: The WorkMail user for which you create the override. Accepts the following types of user identities:

DeviceId.Description: The mobile device for which you create the override. DeviceId is case insensitive.

Effect.Description: The effect of the override, ALLOW or DENY .

OrganizationId.Description: The organization ID.

ClientToken.Description:
Idempotency token used when retrying requests.
This field is autopopulated if not provided.

OrganizationId.Description: The Amazon WorkMail organization under which you're creating the domain.

DomainName.Description: The name of the mail domain to create in Amazon WorkMail and SES.

OrganizationId.Description: The identifier for the organization under which the user, group, or resource exists.

EntityId.Description: The identifier for the user, group, or resource to be updated.

Email.Description: The email for the user, group, or resource to be updated.

OrganizationId.Description: The identifier of the organization that contains the user for which the password is reset.

UserId.Description: The identifier of the user for whom the password is reset.

Password.Description: The new password for the user.

ClientToken.Description:
The idempotency token for the client request.
This field is autopopulated if not provided.

OrganizationId.Description: The identifier associated with the organization.

EntityId.Description: The identifier of the user or resource associated with the mailbox.

RoleArn.Description: The ARN of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that grants write permission to the S3 bucket.

KmsKeyArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the symmetric AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key that encrypts the exported mailbox content.

S3BucketName.Description: The name of the S3 bucket.

OrganizationId.Description: The Amazon WorkMail organization where the availability provider will be tested.

DomainName.Description: The domain to which the provider applies. If this field is provided, a stored availability provider associated to this domain name will be tested.

EwsProvider.Description: Describes an EWS based availability provider. This is only used as input to the service.

LambdaProvider.Description: Describes a Lambda based availability provider.

OrganizationId.Description: The Amazon WorkMail organization for which the AvailabilityConfiguration will be updated.

DomainName.Description: The domain to which the provider applies the availability configuration.

EwsProvider.Description: The EWS availability provider definition. The request must contain exactly one provider definition, either EwsProvider or LambdaProvider. The previously stored provider will be overridden by the one provided.

LambdaProvider.Description: The Lambda availability provider definition. The request must contain exactly one provider definition, either EwsProvider or LambdaProvider. The previously stored provider will be overridden by the one provided.

OrganizationId.Description: The Amazon WorkMail organization for which to list domains.

DomainName.Description: The domain name that will become the default domain.

OrganizationId.Description: The identifier for the organization that contains the user for whom to update the mailbox quota.

UserId.Description: The identifer for the user for whom to update the mailbox quota.

MailboxQuota.Description: The updated mailbox quota, in MB, for the specified user.

OrganizationId.Description: The Amazon WorkMail organization under which the rule will be updated.

MobileDeviceAccessRuleId.Description: The identifier of the rule to be updated.

Effect.Description: The effect of the rule when it matches. Allowed values are ALLOW or DENY .

DeviceTypes.Description: Device types that the updated rule will match.

NotDeviceTypes.Description: Device types that the updated rule will not match. All other device types will match.

DeviceModels.Description: Device models that the updated rule will match.

NotDeviceModels.Description: Device models that the updated rule will not match. All other device models will match.

DeviceOperatingSystems.Description: Device operating systems that the updated rule will match.

NotDeviceOperatingSystems.Description: Device operating systems that the updated rule will not match. All other device operating systems will match.

DeviceUserAgents.Description: User agents that the updated rule will match.

NotDeviceUserAgents.Description: User agents that the updated rule will not match. All other user agents will match.

OrganizationId.Description: The organization that contains the user, group, or resource to update.

EntityId.Description: The user, group, or resource to update.

Email.Description: The value of the email to be updated as primary.

OrganizationId.Description: The identifier associated with the organization for which the resource is updated.

ResourceId.Description: The identifier of the resource to be updated.

Name.Description: The name of the resource to be updated.

BookingOptions.Description: The resource's booking options to be updated.

OrganizationId.Description: The identifier for the organization under which the users exist.

PaginationConfig.Description: A dictionary that provides parameters to control pagination.
